text: “Elite universities... bend over backwards to admit disadvantaged students into their hallowed halls, but then, once the students are there, they maintain policies that not only remind those students of their disadvantage, but even serve to highlight it.”
author: TyMcCormick

text:
The Japanese word tsundoku means “a stack of books that you have purchased but not yet read.”

Is there a word for “stack of books I have purchased and read the first 100 pages of before getting sidetracked?” Because that would be relevant to my life.
author: TyMcCormick
